statements.name: PROC BINNING
statements.description: The BINNING procedure performs binning in SAS Viya. Binning is a common step in the data preparation stage of the model-building process. You can use binning to classify missing variables, reduce the impact of outliers, and generate multiple effects. The generated effects are useful and contain certain nonlinear information about the original variables.
statements.help:
PROC BINNING <options>;                 
	CODE  FILE=filename;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	INPUT  variables </ options>;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=libref.data-table<options>;                 
	TARGET  variable / <options>;                 
	WEIGHT  variable;

arguments.name: BINMISSING=
arguments.description: specifies whether to use missing values of the input variables for the binning process

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC BINNING to use

arguments.name: FUZZYCOMPARE=
arguments.description: specifies the fuzzy comparison threshold that is used to determine the distinctness of numeric values

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies which binning method to use

arguments.name: BUCKET
arguments.description: uses the bucket binning method

arguments.name: CUTPTS
arguments.description: uses the cutpoints binning method and specifies the lower and upper bounds of the bin

arguments.name: QUANTILE
arguments.description: uses the quantile binning method

arguments.name: TREE{
arguments.description: uses the tree-based binning method

arguments.name: CRITERIA{
arguments.description: specifies the criteria for growing the tree for the tree-based binning method

arguments.name: GAIN
arguments.description: uses the gain in information (decrease in entropy) as the tree-growing criterion

arguments.name: GAINRATIO
arguments.description: uses the gain ratio in information (decrease in entropy ratio) as the tree-growing criterion

arguments.name: GINI
arguments.description: uses the Gini statistic as the tree-growing criterion

arguments.name: SSE
arguments.description: uses the sum of squared error as the tree-growing criterion

arguments.name: DISTINCTCOUNTLIMIT=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of distinct levels that interval variables can have in order for them to be treated as nominal variables, where integer can be any integer between 2 and 30,000, inclusive

arguments.name: INITBIN=
arguments.description: specifies the initial number of bins for interval input variables to start the tree-based binning process

arguments.name: INITMETHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method to initialize the tree-based binning for interval input variables

arguments.name: LEAFSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the allowed minimum number of observations per leaf for tree-based binning

arguments.name: MAXNBINS=
arguments.description: specifies the desired maximum number of bins for all variables

arguments.name: MINNBINS=
arguments.description: specifies the desired minimum number of bins for all variables

arguments.name: WINSOR
arguments.description: uses the Winsorized binning method and specifies the rate that it uses

arguments.name: MISSINGBINSTATS=
arguments.description: specifies whether to use the bin that contains the missing values for binning analysis such as WOE and IV

arguments.name: MISSINGEVALNONEVENT=
arguments.description: specifies whether to consider missing values of the target variable as nonevents

arguments.name: NUMBIN=
arguments.description: specifies the global number of binning levels for all binning variables

arguments.name: PERCENTILETOLERANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the tolerance for percentile computation

arguments.name: PERCENTILEMAXITERATIONS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations for percentile computation

arguments.name: RAW=
arguments.description: specifies whether to process variables by using their raw values or formatted values

arguments.name: WOE
arguments.description: computes the weight of evidence and information values

arguments.name: WOEADJUST=
arguments.description: specifies the adjustment factor for the weight-of-evidence calculation, where number is between 0 and 1, inclusive

statements.name: CODE
statements.description: generates score code and stores it in a file that can be used for scoring purposes

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the filename of the file to write the SAS score code to

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: names one or more variables as input variables for binning

arguments.name: NUMBIN=
arguments.description: specifies the number of binning levels for all binning variables in the current INPUT statement

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies whether to treat the specified variables as interval or nominal

arguments.name: INTERVAL
arguments.description: treats all variables that are specified in this INPUT statement as interval

arguments.name: NOMINAL
arguments.description: treats all variables that are specified in this INPUT statement as nominal

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: enables you to write an output table back to the CAS server by creating an output data table{} that contains the results of PROC BINNING

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC BINNING to use

arguments.name: OUTLEVELBINMAP=
arguments.description: names the output bin-mapping data table for PROC BINNING to use

arguments.name: COPYVAR=
arguments.description: lists one or more variables from the input data table to be transferred to the output data table

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: When the value of the METHOD= option is BUCKET, QUANTILE, WINSOR, or CUTPTS, the TARGET statement names the variable that PROC BINNING uses to calculate the weight of evidence and information value

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the target event category that PROC BINNING uses to calculate the weight of evidence and information value in a quoted string of characters

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies whether to treat the target variable as interval or nominal

arguments.name: INTERVAL
arguments.description: treats the target variable as interval

arguments.name: NOMINAL
arguments.description: treats the target variable as nominal

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: variable is used to weight each observation to perform a weighted analysis of the data
